title: Keen Speedrunning: Records, Videos, Discussion
content:
[center] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] The Official Commander Keen Games' Speedrunning World Records. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [/center]


To get on this list, just post your time together with a video of it here on this thread. To capture videos, use the newest DOSBox software.
To download a video, click on the time.
To watch most of these videos you need [url=http://files.filefront.com/ZMBV_Codecrar/;5117423;;/fileinfo.html]ZMBV Codec[/url]. To install it, unpack it and right click the codec file and click Install.

*** How to capture videos: ***
Use Google to get all neccessary software. Download and install DOSBox 0.65. Go to its directory and open dosbox.conf with Notepad or anything similiar. Change frameskip=0 value to 1. This will make videos capture in 35FPS, not 70FPS, reducing video size significantly. Now you're ready to capture your videos. To do that, load Keen into your DOSBox (by typing "mount c c:\keen1directory", "c:" and "keen1"). Then just press Ctrl+Alt+F5 to start or stop recording. You should start recording at the main menu and end it after the ending movie. After you have finished recording your movie, you have to compress the audio. To do that, open your video in VirtualDub (or download and install it first). Then choose to have full compression for audio. Choose Lame MP3 codec for compressing (or download and install it first). Choose 64kbps bitrate. Now test if the movie runs well and then just compress it with WinRAR and upload it to a permanent upload site (like Filefront.com). Congratulations.

title: Re: Keen SPEEDRUNNING! How fast can you complete them?
content: If DOSBox records video, couldn't you just trim the video to a set spot (e.g. the first frame when the screen 'fades up' at the start of the game/level) and then check the running time of the video?  That should give you a pretty accurate indication of time.

title: Re: Keen SPEEDRUNNING! How fast can you complete them?
content: I time my runs from the first frame that keen appears on map after "Keens left" message disappears and until the frame of final blow to the boss in Keen 3, or the moment that Keen has entered the exit door (the frame he is no longer visible in the level) for the final level in Keen 1 and 2. That's pretty it.

title: Re: Keen SPEEDRUNNING! How fast can you complete them?
content: Today I ran Keen 5 for the first time. There aren't many notable shortcuts, nor any levels to skip, just need some accuracy when jumping and have to know where exactly to go. Comparing to Keen 2, it's a lot easier since there's a lot less randomness in enemies' behavior here but the game is a lot longer. Only threat can be the Big Red guys in 2 or so levels and unexpected pink robots sliding down the poles... And one diagonally sliding crystal near end of one of the levels. Gotta be especially precise in last 2 levels, there are quite a lot places with dangerous jumps. I'm measuring a time of around 25 minutes. I'll get onto it tomorrow perhaps.

content:
Ok so I have been working on a Commander Keen 6 speedrun. I am doing pretty good except for when I try Bloogfoods.

In the second part of the level where the switches are I just can't figure out which switches turn on what elevators, or in short, which ones need to be flipped and which don't.

[url=http://dosclassics.com/keen/map.php?a=6&l=8]The map.[/url]

If someone could tell me that would be great!

Thanks.

(By the way. Have we agreed on a difficulty setting? I have just been using "normal" for my speedruns.)-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/New-blegd-smeeg-banner-60.png[/img][/url]

title: Ok
content:
The switches across the bottom right of Bloogfoods, from Left to Right, are the following:

Higher bridge (with "OK" blocks)
Lower bridge (fudgcicles)
Highest platform (left to right)
Lower bridge (fudgcicles)
Lowest platform (used to get up to conveyor belt)
Second platform (used to get up to switch + blooguard)

The switch on the platform with that blooguard operates the 3rd platform (which takes you up to the top)

The switch up at the top turns on a platform that lets you get all those rootbeer floats at the top of the level in the section directly to the left.

:-) Hope that helps.

Edit: Ironically enough, the switches you absolutely NEED to flip are the furthest away. You need to get 6, 5, and 3 to reach the sandwich, unless you're really creative with the pogo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: NOW HERE'S A JAWDROPPER!
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] Commander Keen 6 - Aliens Ate My Babysitter [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

After tons of testing, practicing, glitch finding, some help from others... I have pulled a video together.

The exact time is 6 minutes and 38,519 seconds from the frame Keen appears on map to the frame Keen touches the babysitter.

Be prepared to see extreme glitch and clipping error exploiting. Also, this is the only Keen game that features the so-called Impossible Bullet trick, which is done by jumping and shooting a bullet under you and if done correctly you stay in the air and when you shoot up you fly in the sky with the bullet. There is also a number of strange clipping errors. I guess it's all because this game wasn't made by the original developers and wasn't tested exactly good.

I guess this run can be improved by anyone with some luck and good timing. You could not take the extra ammo in Guard Post 1 if you were sure you would do every Impossible Bullet on the first try :P

Anyway, the video is up. This time I compressed the audio more and made an XviD version too, although it has worse quality and bigger filesize than the ZMBV version, which is weird.

title: Re: hey
content:
Levelass, the site explains the concept.
At least, I visited the front page and noticed a few links which seem like they do some explaining. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Without having read those, but I think I am correct anyway, basically you can play the game normally and save the state (basically everything exactly as it is on the screen at that moment) until you die because of hitting an enemy.
When that happens, you load the saved state, and try again.
If there are 2 enemies next to eachother that you can theoretically fit in between of, but practically can't because it's impossible to be precise enough... now you can anyway because you can just keep on trying until you do it right.
Also there are probably ways of doing slow motion stuff.

(This makes me think of Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time, which rocks by the way.)Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: hey
content:
First one that I'm going to improve now will be Keen Dreams [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I haven't recorded anything yet but other than small optimizations I can see 2 major improvements - one is grabbing just the key in Melon Mines to save getting one in the Castle - might save a few seconds, not 100% sure yet. The other one is abusing death in Spud City after getting the set of Bombs in the sky - I go the the right border of the level and die, finishing the level - that's about 5-10 seconds faster than walking to the left side, although very dangerous - the success of a run attempt will pretty much depend on how the melee and projectile throwing enemies are positioned - I need 1 of them, preferably the Frenchy positioned as close to the right border as possible while the others are easily disposable. Though it's not very likely.

I'd expect a time of about 5:30
